DataElement.preferredName: Heart Radiation Therapy Dose 5 Percent Prescription Dose Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value for the percentage of heart tissue receiving 5% of the prescription dose of radiation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Heart Radiation Therapy Dose 5 Percent Prescription Dose
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood)._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::5_A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred)._A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Property.preferredDefinition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::5:A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).:A doctor's order for medicine or another intervention.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).
A verbal or written order given by an authorized person instructing a patient to obtain and use a medical device, prescription or undergo a procedure.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed that is a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/23/18 jk chg reg status to Standard as part of RECIST FG content; reused by 30 CDEs and multiple SOs. 10-19-2018 TMT received permission from BC to transfer ownership from NIDCR to NCI Standards.
